subSections.title: Translingual
Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In mainland China, Hong Kong (based on its educational standard), Japanese [[kanji]] and Vietnamese [[Hán Nôm]], the bottom right component is written {{l|mul|⺝}} with a vertical {{l|mul|丨}} left stroke.
* In Taiwan, the bottom right component is written {{l|mul|月}} with a curved {{l|mul|丿}} left stroke.
* In Korean [[hanja]], the bottom right component is written {{l|mul|円}} which is the historical form found in the [[w:Kangxi Dictionary|Kangxi Dictionary]].
